Google has shocked its shareholders by announcing that Eric Schmidt , its current CEO, is to step down in April and co-founder Larry Page will replace him in the chief executive officer role. When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined, even in my wildest dreams, that we would get as far, as fast as we have today , starts Eric Schmidt in a post on the company's blog, while also posting on Twitter that the move was no longer about needing to supervise founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin :`` Day-to-day adult supervision is no

`` In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come,'' Eric Schmidt said. Larry Page praised Eric Schmidt , too. There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly, Larry Page said.`` Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him.'' Howard Stern to David Letterman : sorry about your sex scandal( video) Instead of deflecting Howard Stern 's apology, David Letterman responded with candor and a bit of reciprocal praise. `` You have been very, very nice to me on the radio and viciously ugly to me on the radio and I except both with equanimity because I know a little bit about how you operate and I'm still fond of your talent and your ability and what you've represented to the United States of America-and of course, the world.
